definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: taste, perceive (NH id.; Aram. t.0em, [[טְעֵים]] taste; As. n. ṭêmû, sense, command, Zim:BP 92 Lyon:Sargontexte 67 Asrb:Annals iii, 95; Ar. t.a9ima eat, taste, examine by tasting; Eth. t’9ma:, t’a9ama:   taste, examine by tasting, etc.)—
taste, of eating in small quantity, sq. acc. [[לָָחֶם]] 1Sa 14:24, [[מְעַט דְּבַשׁ]] v:1Sa 14:29, so v:1Sa 14:43 ([[טָעִם טָעַמְתִּי]]); [[לֶחֶם אוֹ כָל־מְאוּמָה]] 2Sa 3:35; [[מְאוּמָה]] Jon 3:7.
of sense of taste, obj. [[אֶת־אֲשֶׁר אׂכַל וְאֶת־אֲשֶׁר]] [[אֶשְׁתֶּה]] 2Sa 19:36; so [[חֵח אׂכֶל יִטְעַם־לוֹ]] Job 12:11; [[חֵח]] [[יִטְעַ ֱלָאֱכׂל]] Job 34:3.

fig. Pr 31:18 she tasteth that her gain is good (obj. cl. c. [[כִּי]]), i.e. she experiences that her trade is profitable; so [[מַעֲמוּ]] [[וּרְאוּ כִּי־טוֹב יהוה]] Ps 34:9 taste ye and see that ´[[י]] is good.
